--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "yurifromtomsk" <neuroevolution@m...> 
> About saturation of sigmoid function. Yes, there is such a problem
> but if we trained network and it DO function properly then maybe  
> it is not actually undesirable. Because ANN is often treated as 
> black box, so its inner structure doesn't make much sense. The 
> main point is input and output parameters interrelationship that 
> we have after network training.

I would agree with this except it's not just the inner structure 
that is affected.  The *outputs* of the network will tend to all be 
0 or 1.  You might say this is ok if it works, but this can't work 
for everything, since in some cases graded response might be 
important.  

ken
